text.0: From sticking to a #sleep schedule to nixing afternoon #caffeine, these simple strategies can help you get better zzz's tonight. https://t.co/Da8DgW6xDd
text.1: Today at noon! Informatics #GrandRounds with #DrBrianHasselfeld. Hear about @HopkinsMedicine scaling up #telemedicine during the pandemic. https://t.co/gO2OWW5WXH https://t.co/WQACvm9Xmg
text.2:
.@RehabHopkins' Tae Chung recently opened a clinic for post-COVID patients who have POTS symptoms (lightheadedness, prolonged fatigue, and brain fog).  (via @EWScrippsCo) 

https://t.co/T0DQZJasaS
text.3: “He learned empathy from his work as a physician, and that directly informed his activism,” says thoracic surgeon Malcolm Brock. “I am driven by that same desire to make life better for those who are less fortunate.” https://t.co/KtUMdyBDtS
text.4: #Covid19 has changed the way @RehabHopkins cares for their patients, particularly those with long-lasting symptoms/side effects. @MGFBmd and @MSKpain_sookim share some of the creative interventions used to respond to a disease they’d never before seen in their medical careers. https://t.co/qbnCpOMr6X
text.5:
"Deliberately taking time to pause & look at art can be therapeutic for both clinicians & pts alike." @SarahCleverMD1 @KamnaBalharaMD @HopkinsMedicine @HarvardMacy @GoldFdtn @HumanitiesinHPE @CMichaelGibson @pccm_doc @rxmuseum @ryznarmd @mkellyhedrick 

https://t.co/IT3JUt5oo2
text.6:

text.7: The Stepping Stones program will continue to help people recovering from #transplant surgery, thanks to an anonymous donor. https://t.co/SEmYHORKMl
text.8: Love that I can receive even my routine care (for my “bionic” ear) from the best, where I work. I am so fortunate.:ear: @HopkinsMedicine @hopkins_ent #MedTwitter https://t.co/p5OGQQJwsQ
text.9: @LrGrGuinn Thank you for sharing and thank you for choosing Hopkins! Well wishes this holiday season.
